titleStmt.title: The maids complaint against the batchelors, or, An Easter-offering for young men and apprentices passionately setting forth the unkindness of men, with their slighting the good old way of matrimony, and forcing several thousands of ripe and willing virgins to spin out miserable lives on earth for want of husbands, and lead apes in hell after their death.

The maids complaint against the batchelors, or, An Easter-offering for young men and apprentices passionately setting forth the unkindness of men, with their slighting the good old way of matrimony, and forcing several thousands of ripe and willing virgins to spin out miserable lives on earth for want of husbands, and lead apes in hell after their death.

notesStmt.note: Answered by: The batchellors answer to The maids complaint. London, 1675.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
